member.name: T:CustomModelCharacterAPI
member.summary: Allows you to create a custom character with model.

member.name: P:CustomModelCharacterAPI.SceneFilePath
member.summary:
The path to the .tscn of your custom model. Inside of your scene, you must have the following child nodes !! with these exact names and paths starting from the top !! - "PlayerCollider" ColliderShape3D object, used to determine when the character collides with other things. - This can be any shape that you want. - "Weapons" Node3D object, used as a placeholder to put the 3d model for the weapon when it's loaded. Its position is determined by the *WeaponsLocation/*WeaponsRotation variables. - "PlayerDetailsOverlay/SubViewport/OverlayLabel" Label object, used to put the player name. - "PlayerDetailsOverlay/SubViewport/HealthBar" ProgressBar object, used to display the player health. - "ShootPoint" MeshInstance3d object, used to determine where the projectile starts from when a player shoots. The projectile will shoot in the direction that the player is pointing. - "Flashlight" SpotLight3D object, turns on when it's dark out.
ex. Infantry (CharacterBody3D) - PlayerCollider (ColliderShape3D) - Weapons (Node3D) - InteractiveArea (Area3D) - - InteractiveAreaShape (CollisionShape3D) - PlayerDetailsOverlay (Node3D) - - SubViewport (Viewport) - - - OverlayLabel (Label) - - - HealthBar (ProgressBar) - - PlayerDetailsLabel (Label) - WeaponColliderArea (Area3D) - - WeaponColliderAreaShape (CollisionShape3D) - ShootPoint (MeshInstance3D) - Flashlight (Spotlight3D)

member.name: P:CustomModelCharacterAPI.ModelMeshInstanceFilePath
member.summary: The actual 3d model of your object. The top level node *must be* a Node3D.

member.name: P:CustomModelCharacterAPI.ModelMeshAnimationPath
member.summary: The path to your AnimationPlayer object inside of your model mesh. This AnimationPlayer *must have* a Walk, Run, Stand, Shoot animation. Even if there's no keyframes in there, they must exist as options.

member.name: P:CustomModelCharacterAPI.ModelMeshMeshInstancePath
member.summary: The path to the actual MeshInstance for your 3d model. This is used to apply texture coloring based off the team.

member.name: P:CustomModelCharacterAPI.ModelMeshMaterialTRESFilePath
member.summary: The path to the material used to skin your 3d model.

member.name: P:CustomModelCharacterAPI.ModelMeshMaterialTRESBehindObjectsFilePath
member.summary: The path to the material used when your model is behind objects.
